Story (5: Mediocre): This Anime has an intresting plot of High Schoolers (why always them? what did they DO wrong?) being summoned to another dimension and fighting some tentacle monsters and Black Knights. Well, this is intresting. Also, 11eyes have a lot of irony inside, while sometimes too obvious that it's a pain to watch. I personally don't like people who only doesnt' care about others unless they have what they want, and would do ANYTHING to get what they want. Also, the story had a very rushed ending (more on overall review).
Art (8: Very Good): The Characters (including the male main character, Satsuki Kakeru)look hot and schmexy(ignore the "chm"). Although the Red Night may be just a color alternation of the original city, I believe that it took a lot of creativity to make the moon black and the night skies dark red. Also, Kusakabe Misuzu's swords are awesome. This isn't being sarcastic. those swords look about as good as Cloud Strife's Fusion Sword. They all have unique shapes and abilities, which kept me intrested in this anime (I am a sword freak)


Sound (10:Outstanding): The music is used very well, and it's really good too. Did you hear the opening theme (aka OP) of the anime? It has a christian (or not) choir theme, electric guitars (they are awesome.), and a japanese woman singing. Just like a fusion. The sound in 11eyes raise the suspense, and it fits really well.


Character (4: Decent): Although the characters may have been thought entirely by the character without any outside impact, this has a really similar character structure just like Clannad and Rozen Maiden.

Satsuki Kakeru     --> Okazaki Tomoya (looks, hair color, hero personality)

Minase Yuka        -->  Furukawa Nagisa (looks, hair color, personality (kind of, in a way that she only loves one person forever)

Kusakabe Misuzu --> Sakagami Tomoyo (personality, the ability to fight well)

Hirohara Yukiko    --> Ibuki Fuko (looks, height)

Tajima Takahisa   --> Furukawa Akio (personality)

Momono Shiori     --> Ichinose Kotomi (looks, personality, item (books))

Lisette Veltoll       --> Suigintou (looks, destruction personality) (Rozen Maiden)


Enjoyment (8: Very Good): Since this anime is based off an 18+ Game, it had a lot of perverted scenes, which kind of shocked me, since this was actually the first H anime I ever saw without noticing. But now I'm fine, and used to the perverted scenes (yes I think I am a perv, woot!)

But if this is not your first time watching a H anime, It would be much easier to enjoy at a faster rate.


Overall (5+8+10+4+8)/5=7.4 (7:Good): Overall, I personally think this was a good anime, with all these problems, but I think it had a rushed ending, and the last boss (Lisette) was too easily defeated, since before she was first sealed, it took more than 60 black knights, but the second time, it took one girl, a boy with an Eye of the Aeon, and one Black Knight. At first, I thought that it would be hopeless when the two (Kakeru and Misuzu) fought Lisette, and when Kakeru was at the verge of death, Yuka would use her powers to break out of the crystal and nullify all violence, and when the two see a chance, they would capture her and send her to another dimension. but it was much more simpler than that. If there was just one more episode of the Good (The "nice" fragments and the black knights) fighting the bad (Lisette), this anime would have been much better. but other than that, everything was practically awesome. I can't sleep!!!

I started 11 eyes with the good feeling, it sounded interesting and looked like something I would enjoy. But I was also warned about how much of a trainreck some find it to be. I'm not the type to let other's opinions bother me so I kept a positive view. It's not the worst anime I ever watched, but I must say it didn't live up to my expectations.
Story: 4/10
This was the worst part of the series. It showed strong potential in the beginning. But with most visual novels turned anime, it didn't live up to it's original work. The first half of the serieshas pretty much next to no development and the second half is awkward at best. You have to ask yourself the question "What even happened?" way too many times. In the end there were too many plotholes.


To be honest, this is what bothered me the most. Normally I can watch any anime as long as it's somewhat interesting and makes sense. This didn't and I literally had to force myself through the episodes, watching 1 or 2 episodes and then putting it on hold. I hate dropping series and that's the reason I wrestled myself through this.



Art: 6/10


The art isn't great, but not bad either. There wasn't much that really caught my eye. I did like how the characters sprung out, even when they were wearing their high school uniforms like all the time. Some battles scenes did look pretty awkward, the choreography was just terrible. Misuzu's sword summoning was the most interesting in this department.



Sound: 8/10


It's kinda sad that this is the only department that's really good. I found the OP and ED really enjoyable and addicting. The BGM was great and does a good job at setting the atmosphere. There were some annoying voice actors under the girls, but hey which anime doesn't have at least one annoying VA.



Characters: 5/10


Stereotypes, stereotypes everywhere. But that was still alright, until Yuka came around. She could crush this score singlehandedly. Even though she was clingy, she was still likable in the beginning. At the end of the series she was my most hated character. She just became way to annoying and I actually hoped she would get killed.


And the way how suddenly everyone regresses into powerless piles of fear. Even though they were sterotypes, the were still likeable. They had their own quirks until suddenly the Kakeru had to become the main point of focus and no one else counted anymore. What. The. Hell. Happened.



Enjoyment: 6/10


This gets a 6 at best. There were some parts that were interesting and the characters were still awesome till the second half. But as I said before, I really had to force myself to finish this. And that's not a good sign.



Overall: 6/10


This show had so much potential and it's sad to see how that turned out. The show is decent, but there are many better series out there. I really want to give the visual novel a try to see how the real experience would be. Please tell me the original work is better than this?

This. Anime. Is. Absolutely. SHIT. 
It sucks. What can I say? IT FUCKING SUCKS! It has virtually no depth to the story, no character development aside from that bitch Yuka and the MC, and absolutely EVERYTHING seemed to revolve around the MC. At one point it was like he was the only relevant character; and yes, it is nice to have an interesting MC at times, but the side characters have to be of equal standing! And as interesting as they were, the show completely abandoned them for the shitty MC. 
Well, here goes. Keep in mind that this is most certainly a spoiler-free review,although it may hint at some things. 


Story - 3

To be honest, I had to skim over the last few episodes because it was so bad, but from what I got of the story, it was a cliche mess. I mean, where have I heard this idea before? Even though I haven't even watched that much anime, I've heard of this concept many, many times before. While I do admit that the supernatural aspect added a nice flair to it, it was overall done in the wrong way. It just felt messy and forced, which is a horrible trait to have in an anime. I will say that I did fine the story of the MC and his sister to be somewhat interesting, but the anime revolved too highly around that lone aspect. I wanted to see some real depth and not forced depth, but I never got that. I'm pretty disheartened, to be frank. 


Art - 5 

The art was alright- but quite frankly, it did look quite cheap. While it doesn't have to be anything fantastic like the animation from Shaft or Ghibli, I would appreciate if there was a little more effort put into it. Nevertheless, it looked alright; the character designs were pretty mediocre, but pretty and thus the art is no higher than a 5. 


Sound - 7 

I admit, the sound was good. The theme song wasn't the best but quite catchy, and while I never really listened to the ending song, it seemed alright from the first couple beats. The background music featured in this show was also quite nice and WOULD help to set the mood if the rest of the show didn't fail to do so. I do quite like some of the soundtracks here, and I'd like to see them put into other anime, although they weren't too special. 


Character - 2

Oh my, the characters. Absolutely dreadful- I can't think of a word better-fitting, and thus I score this section a 2. While I won't give any spoilers, the characters were awfully cliche and bland. Most of them had little development and selling points, failing to capture the viewer's interest. This being said, the MC seems to highly stray from this category to the point where it's too much, and he becomes the only relevant character. At one point, everything seemed to revolve around him and the side characters became increasingly weak. The thing is, the MC wasn't even that interesting since the layers of his character were so messy, cliche and cheap. Really, absolutely awful work done on the characters here. 


Enjoyment - 2

SNOOOOOORREEEEE. I had to speed up some of the episodes 4x and skim over the last few because it was just so utterly boring. It didn't have a nice tone to it, and it left a bad flavour in my mouth- even though I didn't exactly watch the whole series, it was a total waste of time. It lacked the suspense and drama that it attempted to bring, and that was where this anime really fell for me. I couldn't engage in it no matter how much I wanted to, and thus I rule it as complete shit. 


Overall - 3 

PLEASE, for your own sake, do not watch this anime. Perhaps newcomers might enjoy it as everything may seem fresh, but if you are experienced with anime and especially this genre, do NOT decide to give it a go.

At first sight it seems to be a classic harem/ecchi cliche, but it's not exactly like that, in this anime the principal characters can die brutal deaths at anytime like in Akame ga Kill and the history is very good, specialy if you like works like Overlord, Accel World and the concept of other-world anime.
The art is a bit outdated but the animation is consistent, if you like other-world anime in general, mistery, light ecchi and also like old style anime it is sure worth your time.
If I had to compare this one to other animes I would say that it reminds me of: ItsukaTenma no Kuro Usagi, Chaos;Head, Akame ga Kill, Accel World. The anime has elements of all these animes, if you like them all, you will certainly like this one.

What started off as something with a lot of potential quickly devolved into pointless amounts of ecchi - particularly underwear shots - and unneeded fanservice. The plot, which held by far the most premise, forgot itself a little past the halfway mark, and turned into complete cop-outs before the show was up.
The main character was fairly dull, and fell into the typical protagonist trope of 'I'm the main character. I'll have all the good shit!'. Though I'll give him his dues, he actually does start off shit, and then improves. Even if he did ruin everything for everyone.
There are good things though. The story islacklustre, but the art style is very fun, a couple of the characters are memorable and well designed, and the opening soundtrack ('Arrival of Tears' by Ayane) is a marvel. It tells you what the story's about, what to expect, and sets the mood, complete with a lot of energy and passion. Everything an anime intro needs.\n\n
Overall though... worth a watch at least. If you can overlook the many problems, and absorb the ONE GOOD PLOT TWIST, then you might even find it enjoyable. A solid 7, as far as I'm concerned.

11eyes had a lot of potential to become an interesting and deep anime, but once again the problems of adapting a visual novel show itself in this anime.
Story - 5/10
Although not the most original concept for an anime, 11eyes had a lot of potential to expand on the world it had created, but unfortunately very quickly shows that it wanted to focus more on other themes than to world build or develop a coherent plot.
Art - 7/10
In my opinion the art was probably the better parts of 11eyes. There are obvious signs that 11eyes is a visual novel adaptation like the cute female characters, butthat didn't seem to get in the way of the darker scenes that the anime tried to pull off. And the contrast between cute characters and the "red night" is actually quite nice.


Sound - 8/10


The soundtrack for 11eyes doesn't necessarily stand out much, however they are not entirely forgettable and fit each scene nicely. The opening and ending songs are very addicting in my opinion, and I am proud to say that I am addicted to them.


Character - 6/10


The characters are definitely where 11eyes falls flat. There is not enough time in 12 episodes to develop these characters that have obviously long and complicated backgrounds and the anime truly shows that. The character personalities are also painfully generic and they don't show much emotion despite the situation they are put in.


Enjoyment - 6/10


11eyes is fairly enjoyable, and to be honest I am being very generous in giving this series and overall 6/10, but it is not entirely horrendous. The show does not fail in at least creating some complications and exciting to watch scenes.


Overall - 6/10


11eyes is definitely deserving of harsh criticism and it shows the many problems that can occur during a light novel adaption, but it does not fall completely on its back. There are worse series out there. If anything 11eyes can be enjoyed as a short series to pass the time.

I was beyond shocked. When I began to watch 11eyes, I was hoping that at least it was better than Chaos Head. But, as it turns out, my hopes were dashed at the final episode. Maybe these types of animes deserve more than 12 episodes, neh?

The storyline. I was fascinated with it. The first episode dragged me into watching and obsessing over this series instantly. At least the story was great.

I'm just a sucker for animes that don't have bad animation. They animators did a fabulous job with this series.

I was going to give this 9 out of 10 . . . but, personally, when one character gets on my nerves, that ruins the whole series for me. I could have done without the Mary-Sueish main character.\n\n
Enjoyment: 5/10\n
See the above. \n\n
Overall: 6/10\n

I'm sure there are people that really enjoy the 'last episodes have nothing to do with the previous episode!' animes. But, this reviewer does not.

it was a good show but personally i think the ending was quite anti climatic as the character i wished that died didnt. and the fact that how it actually ended wasnt bad at all it was just disappointing at the fact that it was like it never happened.

I have just finished watching the entire anime series of 11 eyes. This is how my experience with this anime ended up being.
I started it up episode one and right off the bat i could tell that our MC in this show is going to have some kind of power with his eye. The creator of this made it obvious. Now the reason he has this eye and why it is important in the story I could not tell you. The reason I say this is I got bored/got lost in this anime. I was so intrigued at first but by episode 9 I waseither dozing off, looking at other anime I could be watching, or just fast forwarding the anime to find out either what's going on or trying to get to a part that is actually interesting. The character aspect of this anime wasn't bad except the lead girl. This girl is the love of our MC and started off as the cliche lovable anime girl. In about episode 10 i'd say this character's personality takes a complete 180 and for some reason becomes a yandere girl. The scenes when she is a yandere girl are so cringe worthy that it made it hard to watch. The final thing this anime pissed me off about was that in the end I had no clue what happened expect something cool apparently happened that made zero sense to me and then ontop of this the MC makes the worst decision of his little anime life.

11 Eyes (never really figured out the title), is a confusing story about a group of special characters (known as fragments) and their struggle to survive an alternate dimension that is triggered seemingly randomly (think like a fuzetsu in Shakugan no Shana with the randomness trigger of day dreams in Yumekui Merry).
The plot progression is very much like in Chaos; Head and Fate Stay Night where the main protagonist is thrown into a foreign, dangerous situation and is forced to adapt; and with the viewer being somewhat confused as the mysteries are slowly unraveled. The downside to this series is that it fails to pullin the viewer's interest in the early episodes (compared to Chaos; Head) and fails to deliver any semblance of a decent conclusion (compared to FSN).


This is a fairly serious series (not too much heavy fan service) with an emphasis on the sharp contrast between normal school slice-of-life and the unreal Red night. While the setting is eventually explicated enough, it is accompanied by a plot line that seems random at times and finishes off with a very annoying ending that isn't even worth spoiling.


Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere for a series, the review by roriconfan already contains lots of related anime, and all the ones I have seen on that review are better. If you must learn why this is utter fail, continue reading.


Animation:

Animation is probably the series' only saving grace. While not gorgeous, the animation is nicely done with decent character designs and average battles (there is significant blood in certain scenes). There is a large focus on dark colors (blood red) to complement the tone of the series. One annoyance is the hordes of very strange-looking creatures in the Red night (obviously deriving from the hentai...) that don't really serve much of a purpose, I found them distracting and utterly not worth the screen time.


Sound:

This is fairly average stuff. OP starts rather interestingly but then becomes somewhat bland while the EP features a girl with crazy vibrato, but the melody just fails. Both fit well enough with the action-base of the series. The BGM is mostly forgettable with a techno-based theme during battles. VAs are average in this series (Daisuke Ono's usual humor potential is wasted on the boring main protagonist) but I blame the characters more than their respective VAs.


Story:

This is where things start going really down hill. At least the premise is decent. You find a guy with one eye (other one is supposedly blind) and a typical girl next door that he likes, and suddenly they're transported to an alternate dimension and he wants to do everything to protect her yay.


Unfortunately that's pretty much the end of the good news. The series then goes through many plot developments based off of way too many crazy explanations (completely unbelievable) to try to help the viewer make sense of what is happening (while still leaving huge plot holes unexplained). This is just way too much combined with characters that start behaving erratically (see next section) and just making a whole mess of something that originally had decent potential.


Example: Person A dies at end of episode x, at beginning of episode x + 1 aha I tricked you A didn't die he/she was transported through a vortex that you didn't see just in the nick of time!).


And like the previous reviewer I also greatly lament the pointless ending.


Character:

This series has greatly underdeveloped characters. A lot of times, the characters are unpredictable, as in they act in a way that isn't consistent with what you know about them at the time. The majority of the character development focuses on the guy (Kakeru) and the two girls interested in him (Misuzu and Yuka). As you can probably guess there is a bit of a love triangle and eventually one of the girls starts going coocoo. This seriously undermines any attachment a viewer might have with the character and leads to very unpredictable wtf moments in the plot line. Yeah they also decided to throw in a bit of an implied sex scene (though nothing to the extent of Yosuga no Sora) though it has absolutely no impact really on the plot line and makes a girl seem like a whore.


Value:

This pretty much takes the cake for being totally not worth your time. There are better girls with sword series, better action-thrillers, better cute-girl-in-distress, etc. While the series does play with a multitude of elements, they are just not integrated in a uniform, consistent package. Save your bandwidth and eyesight for something else.

I said to cut it short but seems like I failed. This review become far away from being short... I am putting the end by stating the anime was good and totally watchable, you won't have any regrets for watching it.

Honestly i was utterly disappointed with this anime. There were a few memorable parts but, man that was just pretty bad. Please do not misunderstand, the art style was what originally attracted me to the anime in the first place however, when I saw a yundere character was the second main character I was all the more excited.
When I had researched the anime better, I noticed the reviews were not too awful so I gave it a shot but when I did, it felt like the story drained all the playfulness of anime and brought out too much seriousness. Even in the dark, twisted anime,the deranged character would at most enjoy his criminal behavior but this anime involved too many serious characters that were pretty hard to like. 


Here is a break down of what I could not get into:


*Weak damsel in distress character= if only she actually embraced her psychotic nature


*The main character agrees to ANYTHING= if only he was more decided


*Love stories incredibly under developed= good luck.


*Overall, I think what I was expecting was mediocrity but was still disappointed in the end.

This is an anime where the sum of it's parts isn't nearly as good as it should be. It was far from perfect, but I will say that I overall enjoyed it and think my time was well spent, even if there were missing pieces.
Story - 6/10
This is really where the anime falls apart. This anime is produced from a fairly long visual novel (only available in Japanese currently) so it has a fairly long and robust story. Unfortunately, the anime doesn't do a great job of bringing over all of the details. I think with 2 seasons they could have made this anime great(as the VN is very highly rated) but due to the short and sometimes wasted time they didn't go into enough detail and often left the watched confused as to what/why/how. This lead to the story sometimes being a jumbled mess. Also, I HAVE to point this out... the huge retcon in the story... they should have just not done that and instead used that time to better explain elements and write a better conclusion.


Art - 9/10


It looks good. I like the character designs, the Crimson Night was badass and overall I have no complaints.


Sound - 8/10


The overall soundtrack was good. The intro was badass, the music set the tone well. The emotional moments were heightened, the fighting scenes were enhances. A very good, even if slightly generic, soundtrack.


Character - 7/10


This is where the best and worst moments were held. The flashbacks from MC were meaningful and heartbreaking. The  development and emotional connection between Yukiko and Takahisa make you feel bad for them and make their fates very real. I haven't seen another anime since Mia-Hime that really made me feel bad for the characters and their fates. All of this is very good... then there is Yuka. Yeesh... yandere much? Totally out of the blue and doesn't fit all that well in the story. Then, of course, everything seems to work itself out and she is OK by the end.


Enjoyment - 6/10


Overall, I enjoyed the anime. I spent a fair amount of time thinking about how these things could happen, and why they were happening. Fortunately, there were enough emotional moments, nice artwork and interesting events to distract me from the random nonsense in the story. 


Overall - 6/10


I went into this knowing it had bad reviews, but overall I think it was a "fair" anime. There is enjoyment to get out of it. Hopefully the VN will be translated to English some day, because the story is definitely worth a read in its entirety. If you're impressed with high quality art and music, and don't care to think too hard about the story, you will definitely find this enjoyable.

11eyes is a fantasy action anime with minimal ecchi elements, in the usual done-to-death highschool setting. I hate ecchi, so I prepared myself with some booze expecting the worst. Despite my low expectations, this anime actually appeared to have a proper plot and a therefore reason to watch it. The start is slow and lacking but it picks up, so don't drop it early. Give this a try if you like this genre/type of story and don't mind a little ecchi. And even if you don't, then at least try the soundtrack which is the best bit. It really isn't half bad.
Animation
When I started towatch this anime I thought it was made within the last few years, the animation quality is actually pretty good. The style isn't too unique, but one of the characters reminded me of a character from my favourite anime of all time. Very smooth and effective ation sequences. It seems to have a bit of a magic/horror style and reminded me of Shakugan no Shana at times. That's gotta be a good thing. This anime is tagged as ecchi and I'll be honest, I barely noticed much in the first half, besides a lot of tasteless unnecessary panty shots from Yuka. I swear that girl has a rip in the back of her skirt. The anime itself doesn't seem to have much of actual ecchi theme, though there has been the cliche 'girl groping other girls,' busty nurse and misunderstandings. No token beach or hot spring scenes either. A pleasant reduction in ecchi (besides those panty shots) and that's coming from someone who despises ecchi and hates out-of-context fanservice. Do keep in mind that I wasn't paying too much attention, the first half due to my inebriation however. I might have missed something like a bath scene or some potential bullshit, but there was barely any in the second half. The blood/gore is fine too, though nothing too extreme. May be a bad thing, but it could just be the look they were going for with this anime.


Sound


Definintely the best bit of 11eyes. I usually skip the intro/outro sequences after the first time, due to time constraints. But this time I really wanted to watch them due to the awesome music. Heck I ended up getting the soundtrack for this anime. This anime also utilises background music well and has great sound design. Sometimes there were scenes with creepy music, to suit the madness and other times there was beautiful instrumental for serious scenes. If the anime was a tad different, it could have been a horror anime, I swear. So, not being reliant on one genre of music and optimising the use of soundtrack is where this anime shines and it does it better than other anime that I've enjoyed more. This anime is only available in Japanese and the voice acting isn't too bad. So subtitles are required, since I assume we don't speak Japanese.


Characters


The main character is Kakeru Satsuki, of course a high school student and a bit of a badass. Especially with his eyepatch covering his heterochromic yellow eye, he appears more of a badass than the designated badass character. When he was younger, his younger sister was killed by some sort of demon. He appears to be romantically involved with Yuka Minase, who is his childhood friend. I should mention that this anime has the trope of having no parents or relative adult characters. He has a hidden power that he has not yet awakened and he wants to train and try his best to use his power to defeat the villianous demons who threaten him and his friends. Revenge could be a hidden motive. He also seems to be a tad unaware of how clingy Yuka is. Maybe needed a bit more development to define his personality better.


Yuka Minase is Kakeru's childhood friend and is infatuated with him. She is an orphan, taken in and raised by the non-existent but mentioned Minase parents. This girl is very clingy and obsessive over Kakeru, it appears she wants his dick so damn bad. I've heard complaints about this character and I'm not sure why. Maybe it was something I wasn't paying attention to in the first half or the thing that happens at the start of episode 11? Occasionally she peeks in on him, leading to misunderstandings over certain things. She is very worried that Kakeru would leave her. This character is also almost the sole source of ecchi in this anime, it really seems as if her skirt is ripped at the back or something. She is often oblivious to dangers due to her concern with everything Kakeru. She appears to dislike Minase as she is worried that she might steal Kakeru.


Misuzu Kusakabe is a swordfighter magic-user who is the latest in the line of the Kusakabe family. She has become solitary, due to extreme dislike from the other Kusakabe's for owning all of 4 legendary swords held by the family, having defeated and killed her own father for the last one and using the forbidden magic. She admires a magic-user that left 70 years ago, who was similarly hated. Similar to Kakeru, she has a concern for to righteousness. She also holds certain feelings... watch it to find out.


At the moment, I can't be bothered to talk about the less important characters. There is the girl/witch trapped in the crystal. The slutty nurse who appears to have a relationship with a student but turns out to be the guys adopted mother.


Story


The story is very much there and is fleshed out relatively well, with twists turns and unexpected developments too. By the way, episode 11 and 12 can be considered as two different endings, otherwise the story progression is bullshit. Behind it all, it is actually a romance story, with all sorts going on. Things actually happen and the story is relatively unpredictable. It is quite unique, with the exception of one other anime which is quite similar. There is an alternate reality called the Crimson Night in the city where the main characters live. Within this realm is a girl trapped in a crystal, the black knights who demonic beings that guard her and prevent her from being freed and other monsters. To free this prisoner and to protect the real world is the goal of the protagonists. It feels a bit complex and complicated at times. Overall the story starts off a bit slow, though that could just be the booze and as good as it is, it doesn't stand out enough and it isn't absolutely amazing. The ending is debatable and kinda disregards all of the plot events in a way. There isn't much to read into, so no social commentary/subtext here.


Conclusion


So, it ain't so bad after all. If you like the whole action/demons/magic idea, especially one where the story is great and things actually happen. I was getting very bored and distracted during the first half, though that was likely due to my drinking. If you hate ecchi like me, try this out since the ecchi is both frontloaded and rather minimal, so you should be fine with the overall anime. Not bad, not bad at all. I was wrong to get drunk for this one.

When I decided to watch 11eyes, I was really excited about the idea of several teenagers, each with awesome powers, joining forces to fight evil. And I was right to be excited about that. But there were other aspects that impeded my enjoyment and tested my patience with the series.
11eyes turns out to be an awful, mushy and painful-to-watch love story between two of the protagonists. Basically, every episode, the two will say the exact same line, over and over again: Kakeru says "I will protect Yuka," while Yuka just repeats Kakeru's name over and over...and over.......and over......................and over again. I suppose that this fallsin line with the plot, but I was hoping for something a little more original. The reason for almost all of the point deductions on the overall score were because of this.


That said, I was still impressed by and thoroughly enjoyed their journeys to the Crimson Night, and the ways that their powers manifested and grew throughout the series. I wished that there would be more fighting and less talking, as this anime had very poor writing, and each of the attempted jokes fell flat on its face and then proceeded to writhe around, and wouldn't die no matter how many times you screamed at the screen (I'm pretty sure that works with other animes :P). 


It is of my opinion that this anime is not a waste of time, but rather, not a productive way to spend time. Something along the likes of purgatory: not good, not bad. Certainly, the fighting is classic and pretty cool, but if you're more of a dialogue-oriented watched and hoping for some good humor or romance (as I presume most of us are) then 11eyes is a huge disappointment.

Story: 5
I wanted so badly to enjoy this series! It had a pretty decent, though cliche story when I started off, but it was interesting. It intrigued me, and I was excited to see where it would lead. However, as the episodes progressed, it was getting more and more ridiculous by the second. Most of my beef is with the characters, which I will address later, but overall, the series just sped downhill after it's launch. 
Art: 7
The art was appealing to look at, definitely adorable with good looking characters. But there was little action. Nothing that really took my breath away with fight scenes,which by the way were sparse, or any other scenes. In fact, sometimes they looked downright awkward. I overlook this with the overall appeal of the scenes and characters in the show.


Sound: 7

Decent. Actually, the opening theme was pretty good, I definitely enjoyed that. But nothing else that really particularly stood out to me.


Character: 5

OKAY. Now I loved the characters at first, I still do some of them. I loved Misuzu. I still do. But I couldn't stand the heroine Yuka, and later Kakeru, the lead male role. The other supporting roles had really interesting traits, characteristics, and talents which made me really enjoy watching this series. However, some of these characters and their total lack of judgement made me go totally insane. I greatly disliked Yuka. And I really don't like hating the lead female role. It irritates the hell out of me but I wanted to reach through my computer screen and pull her out of that series. It ruined the series for me. 


Enjoyment: 6

There were some really weird things going on in this series. Certainly not conventional. It was a littler eerie and kind of weird. Really tok away from the enjoyment of it. I didn't like the ending, had to force myself to bear with it. 


Overall: 6

I stuck around long enough to finish it so I can't say it was totally horrible. It still had interesting potential that was intriguing to watch. I'd recommend it if you don't mind weird twists that's a little dark. It's just not the series for me.

The studio in charge of 11-Eyes (Say, Marvelous Entertainment) is commonly known for its stories who can surprise at the same time that give you goose bumps, either it is for its involving plot (Mushishi, AKB0048), easy to hate characters (Ichiban Ushiro no Daimao, School Days) or just for poor execution of the plot, characters… and everything else. Unfortunately, that’s exactly the case we have in hands today.
Meet Kakeru and Yuka, two childhood friends who without knowing why, end up in a world where the sky is red, and the moon is black, the streets are filled with rampaging monsters and the danger awaits inevery corner.


Not knowing what to do know, they start they quest to get out of this dimension, but, as fast as it came the “Red Night” ends up again and, SURPRISE! There are 4 other people who also where there, little did they know that this red night gats them powers, such as legendary sword casting, killer instinct, and pyromancy.


4 episodes into the series, knowing close to nothing about the characters, they start to fall in battle with the Black Knights, who as the antagonist of the series, start to kill the main characters, one by one, always with time to yell to our heroes to hand over the fragments, but never with time to explain what they are, or why they want it… or even why they are attacking.


With all this there is little room to character development, leading to forced relationships, decent action scenes who, though entertaining, doesn’t add anything to the overall plot (most of the times), and feel like time fillers.


In the art, and soundtrack there’s nothing outstanding, thought the music is well related to what’s happening in the scene, with all the nonsense yelling, you can barely notice the music. And when you realize there is music, is in scenes so boring and out of context that is just distracting.


Score:

Story/Plot: 4

Characters: 5

Art: 6

Sound Track: 6

Personal Enjoyment: 5

Overall: 5
